definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: For the first hours without him, I cried. A lot.
sentences.chinese: 在没有它的第一个小时，我痛哭流涕。

sentences.english: Here and there, it was screams, tears of distress and grief.
sentences.chinese: 到处是尖叫声和痛哭流涕。

sentences.english: If we couldn't have the hairpin , how can we do not burst into tears?
sentences.chinese: 如果连这枚草簪都无法拥有，我们怎能不痛哭流涕呢？

sentences.english: On hearing that her dad died, she cried her eye out.
sentences.chinese: 一听到她爸爸去世，她便痛哭流涕。

sentences.english: They came to a house in which lived a man named Chen Cheng and his family. The whole family was crying.
sentences.chinese: 他们来到一户叫陈澄的家中，见全家人正痛哭流涕。

sentences.english: Mary broke bown tearfully when she was told the death of her husband.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽听到她丈夫的死讯时痛哭流涕。

sentences.english: I bitterly wept and wished that I had had the heart to give thee myall .
sentences.chinese: 我痛哭流涕，悔恨自己没将全部都献给你。

sentences.english: As soon as you thought own love love history, can cry one's heart out, numb.
sentences.chinese: 沵一想到自己旳爱情史，会痛哭流涕，麻木不仁。

sentences.english: At his grave today, I cried like a baby.
sentences.chinese: 在他下葬的那天，我像个孩子一样痛哭流涕。

sentences.english: You have been so good to me I feel I could burst with gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 你们对我如此的好，我几乎要痛哭流涕了。

sentences.english: She cried bitterly, rending her hair with her hands.
sentences.chinese: 她痛哭流涕，一边用手扯她的头发。

sentences.english: I opened up the minibar and drank down one of those pathetic little bottles of champagne.
sentences.chinese: 我忍不住痛哭流涕，打开吧台喝光了一小瓶香槟。

definition: to shed tears while recounting sth/speaking in a tearful voice
tears and mucus flowing profusely/sniveling/in a tragic state
to weep disconsolately/to cry on each other's shoulder
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to beat one's chest and stamp one's feet (idiom)
to bury one's head in one's hands and weep (idiom)
tears and mucus flowing profusely (idiom); weeping tragically
